benchmark_details.name: Flower
benchmark_details.overview: Flower is a novel federated learning framework designed to support large-scale training on heterogeneous edge devices, facilitating both algorithmic experiments and system-level evaluations. It allows for seamless migration between simulation and real-world deployments, targeting a larger number of clients in federated settings.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive federated learning framework that enables research and experimentation with scalable and heterogeneous client environments.

data.source: Data from federated learning clients including public datasets like CIFAR-10 and Fashion-MNIST.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the aggregated results from federated clients after each round of training.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and lower training time indicate better performance of the federated learning framework.
methodology.baseline_results: FedAvg and other FL methods compared to traditional centralized training metrics.
methodology.validation: Performance validated through extensive experiments on real devices and simulations with varying client conditions.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Flower implements secure aggregation methods to maintain client data privacy.
